abstracts.cdata!:
The Fertilizer Sector Ajustment Loan
            Project is a hybrid policy and investment loan intended to
            support the first steps in the implementation of the
            Government's and the Mexican Fertilizer Company's
            (FERTIMEX) five-year program to put the fertilizer subsector
            on a sound competitive basis and eliminate Government
            subsidies. The project aims to achieve this through a series
            of reforms of the policy framework and the implementation of
            supporting rationalization investments. Major policy reforms
            involve significant price adjustments of inputs and outputs,
            closure of uneconomic plants, liberalization of distribution
            and imports, setting up a better organizational structure in
            the sector, financial restructuring of FERTIMEX and the
            carrying out of a program of economically viable
            investments. These objectives will be achieved through Bank
            financing of three components with a total loan amount of
            US$265 million. These imports include fertilizers and
            fertilizer raw materials and other imports in support of
            policy reforms; (b) rationalization investments of the
            production and distribution infrastructure in support of
            policy reforms; and (c) technical assistance.
